content.description:
A fine route with a fine wine name.

Some crazy weird moves through the roof.

Just follow the bolts.
content.protection: 11 bolts, and I used some cams but can't remember if they are really needed, well bolted, just freaky onsight. The start and the upper slab are run-out. Chain rap anchor.

content.description: Left of the crack, its a tricky sport climb.
A really fun route, maybe challenging for a new 5.8 leader.
content.location: furthest east, down hill and separate from main Hobo wall. There are 2 5.7 routes to the left.

climbs.name: Slowpoke
climbs.fa: Sean Woods, Viktor Kramar, Gordon Briody; 2009

content.description:
40' of easy climbing protected by gear up a ramp leads to a lieback flake and then a roof. Stay right and pull over the roof, then make an airy leftward traverse on small feet above the roof on its lip to the first bolt (at about 50').

The book appears to show the route traversing left

below

the roof before going over, but there's some loose rock this way. The rightward variation keeps the grade of 5.7-8 seems safer, albeit more heady.

From here, head up on a mildly featured slab and plug a large piece (BD #4 or 5) and head up to the last two bolts before the chains.

Fun face climbing route, but not great for a beginner or new trad leader; it's kinda heady I thought.
content.protection: Singles BD #0.3- 2 or 3, plus a #5. Bolted anchor with chains.
content.location:
Look for the upward left-trending ramp just left of the shady trees that lead to the far side of Hobo Gulch (where

Vulgar Goatmen,

etc. are located). It starts in the open, not in the trees.

Not to be confused with the chimney route in the trees, which is Mulligan Stew (5.7).

content.description:
A good route with a bouldery start, blocky midsection, and fun moves through the roof.

The guide book calls it 10d, compared to the Nose at Castle it is easier, maybe 10c.
content.protection: 7 bolts, and I used supplemental gear. I think after the first bolt I used a cam and somewhere up higher too.Shares anchor with Hobo Erectus.
content.location: just left of Hobo Erectus. Beware of Poison ivy at the base.

content.description: Short and pumpy clip-up that first traverses up and right, then up. Crux is at/around the 3rd bolt moving right.
content.location: Second shady oasis on the far right side of Hobo Gulch just past (right) of Mudslinger. Look for the cool looking black and white streaks. Chains are just out of view, but you can see all 5 bolts.

content.description: Starts up an open book, then steps left up a short but fun, bolt protected crux. A great warmup or beginner lead with bolts right where you want them.
content.protection: 4 bolts = chain anchor. Small cam or nut optional- only if you really want to sew up the easy section above the first bolt.
content.location: Middle of the right half of Hobo Gulch. Look for the bolt in the open book to the left of Slowpoke's mini-roof. Most bolts are visible from the ground.

content.description: Allot like other Leavenworth 5.9's, broken thin cracks, face moves but well worth doing
content.location: When you approach up the main center trail this route is to the right, starts up a black slab, follows a cleft straight up to below the roof.

climbs.name: Mulligan Stew
climbs.fa: Sean Woods, Viktor Kramar, Gordon Briody; 2009

content.description:
Only adding this so it doesn't get confused with

Slowpoke

, its neighbor to the left.

Chimney route that starts in the trees just left of

Vulgar Goatman

. At the top of the chimney, you'll arrive at bolt #1. Continue up broken cracks through 5 bolts to the bolted anchor.

Alternate start if you wish to avoid the chimney is to scramble up to a ledge on the left and then downclimb about 10' to the first bolt. This is the ledge you'll rappel to (120' chains, so you have to belay up a second to clean and rap to this ledge).
content.protection: 5 bolts, gear to 1" and bolted anchor.
content.location:
In the trees just left of

Vulgar Goatmen

and about 30' to the right of

Slowpoke.

The chimney is pretty obvious to miss, but if you're having a hard time, walk down the hill and look for the single visible bolt above the trees.

content.description: Fun bolted clip-up to the right of Vulgar Goatmen. Might as well do it if you're there...
content.location: Directly right of Vulgar Goatmen, with the climbs right of the main Hobo gulch crag

content.description:
First bolt is 20+ feet from the ground, so protect the beginning with a cam, or stick clip the first bolt.

Stem the crack at the start of the route, and follow up to fun slabs under the overhang.
content.protection: 7 bolts. Optional cam before first bolt.
content.location: Left of Thunderbird or big black wet streak, and right of Strike While It's Hot. Look for the bolt above a broken crack system

content.description: Starts in a wide slot on clean granite and then jumps left into a short hand crack. A fun move gets you into a finger crack, leading to a slab with a lone bolt. Good fun for the grade.
content.protection: Gear to 3", but a #4 won't go unused down low. Chain anchors.
content.location: Far right side of Hobo Gulch, just around the corner to the right of Shakin' the Bacon's alcove. If you get to a giant ponderosa, you've gone about 15' too far down the trail..

content.description: (Several variations possible) Move up a mini-buttress via broken cracks on licheny rock. There's a few moves that would be easier if brushed, but the dirtiness makes it 5.7 instead of 5.6. Has an adventurous feel with several blocky 5-easy sections breaking up the actual climbing. Build and an anchor where near the top of the gully, belay up your second, and scramble around to the base.
content.protection: Gear to 3", bring a BD #4 if you've got it. Save some for a gear anchor up top.
content.location: Look for the absolute rightmost arm/buttress of the Hobo formation, just uphill from a ponderosa pine with a burnt base.

content.description: Pretty fun route, especially below and at the roof. After the committing roof move it is a easy slab above wandering left to share last 2 bolts and anchor with Sloppy Joes.
content.protection: 6 bolts and some cams. I think between the 4th and 5th bolt a cam is good to have and after the 5th bolt over the roof there is a traverse where a cam is good too. I can't remember what size, single small rack to 2" should do.
content.location:
furthest to the right when you are facing the main Hobo wall, it goes to the right of the overhanging roof.

Beware of Poison Ivy at the base.

content.description: Squeezed in with some area classics, this route is bolted below but can take some pro for run out sections.  Fun climb!

A great crack climb. Worth seeking out. I did the left hand start because it looked more interesting to layback up the flake. There is a thin right ward traverse into another good crack and some wandering to find the top. The only anchor is way back and to the notch for rapping, or you can lower off it and belay your 2nd up while sitting up the hill watching them climb.
content.protection:
gear to 2", maybe 2 each of .75, #1 and #2 Camalot.

There  is a bolted anchor up and over the top, I am guessing it is placed so one can reach a high point on the hill with a 60m rope rappel. I think I added a sling in 2013
content.location: This is down the hill way left of the main Hobo wall, near the left end of a buttress the crack is just before a drop off and arete on the left.

content.description: On the center of the wall, and the driest portion thus more white then black.
content.protection: 4 bolts, and I definitely recommend the 3/4" cam for 1st piece. Bolted anchor below the roof.
content.location: in front of you as you come up the main trail, centered under the big roof slightly more to the left side.

climbs.name: Easy Mark
climbs.fa: Sean Woods, Russ Ricketts, Victor Kramar, 2009

content.description: In corner, to Arête and easy terrain
content.location: Left of Hobophobic and Strike It While It's Hot

content.description: Start at the base of a short dihedral marked with a bolt to protect the initial moves. Solid holds under the overhang start the route then you do some harder moves to gain the dihedral. A hidden hold at the beginning of the corner made it reasonable. Climb thin crack/face holds on gear till the top of the corner where you can reach the 1st of the 3 bolts that comprise the last part of the route. Several moves of thin face holds lead to glorious jugs and the chain anchors.
content.protection: Just a few pieces between bolts should be enough. I used a ~1/2 in. stopper and a 3/4 in. cam between the 2nd and 3rd bolt. Chain anchors.
content.location: Lowest bolted route on the left part of the main wall of Hobo, i.e. left of Flagrant Vagrant. Look for a bolt under the dihedral.
